speaker: Episode 55 - The Suffering Game - Chapter Five
Griffin
lines: Previously, on The Adventure Zone

speaker: Griffin
lines: This doorway opens in the wall and three names appear above it

speaker: Antonia, Rowan, and Lord Artemis Sterling.
Rowan
lines: Welp guys, uh, guess I’ll see you on the other side—

speaker: Cam
lines: Hey guys, uh, my name’s Cam! Oh, I mean I’ve been here for a long time but I got screwed over. But that’s— that’s not important—

speaker: Magnus
lines: This goes against everything I believe.

speaker: Taako
lines: Well, luckily it’s not your decision. Forsake!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright… and they chose trust!

speaker: Taako
lines: Hell yeah!

speaker: Edward
lines: Live from the inescapable depths of Wonderland, it’s time for another round of Heart Attack! The heroic dating show.

speaker: Taako
lines: I cast True Seeing on Magnus.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You see that Red Robe, and you just see this Red Robe put a single skeletal finger to its nonexistent lips.

speaker: Announcer
lines: Fret not dear listener! It’s always darkest before the dawn… unless of course you’re locked in some sort of pain dungeon… it’s The Adventure Zone!

speaker: [THEME MUSIC
lines: “Déjà Vu” by Mort Garson (full song on YouTube)]

speaker: Edward
lines: Madness, what does it mean to be a hero?

speaker: Travis
lines: He did just call me “Madness.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Did I?

speaker: Justin
lines: It sounded like “madness” to me—

speaker: Travis
lines: You definitely said “madness.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, no.

speaker: Clint
lines: Was that a clue? That was a clue, wasn’t it! It was a clue! I bet it was a clue.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, start over, second take, put that one in the blooper reel.

speaker: Clint
lines: Madness, got it.

speaker: Edward
lines: Magnus, what does it mean to be a hero?

speaker: Griffin
lines: The two liches in front of you — who you can see in their true form — are still giving you the same prompt, Magnus, and— you don’t really know where this sight came from, right? ’Cause Taako didn’t give you a heads-up. But you— you blink a couple of times and the True Sight fades and—

speaker: Justin
lines: I don’t wanna be a rules guy, but he does have True Sight for an hour. So I do not know why that vision would be fading so quickly when I cast correct!

speaker: Justin
lines: Woo-Hah, Woo-Hah. I’ve got you all in check.

speaker: Clint
lines: I’m gonna re— retweet that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay but this is just gonna be a lot of kinda— yeah, sure, fuck it, why not. Yeah, alright, you still got the True Sight and it’s still on ya, and you have it for a whole hour. And you— you just see this Red Robe and now he’s just kinda floating uncomfortably in front of you—

speaker: Griffin
lines: He’s uh, his main planned interaction—

speaker: Justin
lines: We don’t know what dope shit we’re gonna be doing in the next hour, I’m not gonna burn a Level 6 spell for your narrative! I’m sorry!

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s fair, that’s fair.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, yeah! You can still see this Red Robe then and he’s just kind of floating expectantly in front of you. And the two elves who you still see as liches— thank you, Justin, for the clarification!

speaker: Justin
lines: Mmhm!

speaker: Griffin
lines: — Uh, don’t seem to take notice of the Red Robe. Your answer, Magnus.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Y’know, if you’d asked me in my younger days, back ten years ago—

speaker: Clint
lines: Or 15 seconds ago.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes, that was the joke, thank you Dad for filling in the punchline!

speaker: Clint
lines: You’re welcome!

speaker: Magnus
lines: I would’ve told you that what makes a hero is— is someone who acts, someone who leaps into the fray without thinking. But, y’know, I’ve had some time to think now, and I would say that I’ve grown a little wiser, and, uhh, I would say that a hero is someone who acts when it counts. Acts at the right moment, acts when it’s needed.

speaker: Griffin
lines: With that, you hear a little bell ring, signalling the end of this game of Heart Attack! And the audience applauds your answer, Magnus, and there’s a little music stinger playing you out. And the two liches say

speaker: Edward
lines: Well, it sounds like our suitor has made their decision! Let’s see who they chose for their hot date.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And that—

speaker: Clint
lines: This is exciting!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And that screen beside all of you drops to the ground, and the— you can see the figure casting the silhouette. It is another one of those marionettes, and because of Taako’s spell, it’s still kind of shuddering and making kind of weird… pseudo-laughing noises? And really, it’s just kind of, like, collapsed onto the ground, and one of its legs is just like repeatedly lifting up and thumping down into the ground…

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay, lemme— I have a question, I’m serious. What do… Ma— I mean, what do Taako and I see? ’Cause he only cast True Sight on Magnus.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You— yeah, you see the same thing. The True Sight just kinda made it so that Magnus could see through the blinding lights—

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: — and see like who was in the studio audience. But you see— You all see this kind of creepy display, and it’s just not stopping, its leg is just THUMP-THUMP-THUMP down into the ground, and Edward says

speaker: Edward
lines: Well… Hm. Well, we learned everything we need to know, so… I guess let’s… call it a draw? Let’s move on. This has gotten frankly a little too weird, even for us.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And uh, they t—

speaker: Merle
lines: But I would’ve won, right?

speaker: Edward
lines: Oh, let’s not, it’s— it’s like Whose Line, baby. The points don’t matter.

speaker: Merle
lines: [laughs] But I would’ve.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And they turn to, like, go but before they do, they say

speaker: Edward
lines: Oh, wait, we need to find out how your opponents in the last round of Trust or Forsake fared!

speaker: Taako
lines: Probably pretty fuckin’ bad, huh?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And a screen appears behind the two of them, and it lights up and you see three figures standing on a glowing square labeled “Finish,” and you recognize that they are on that board game that loaded into this room previously. It’s all sprawled out behind them. And it takes you a second to recognize them because all of the sacrifices they’ve gone through here in Wonderland have changed them pretty dramatically.

speaker: But it’s the three adventurers that you met in the Felicity Wilds. It’s Rowan and Antonia and Lord Artemis Sterling. And they look rough. Sterling is the worst off. First of all, he’s no longer, like, a young, like, boy-man? He’s aged probably it looks like into like his late 30s and his hair’s gone an early bright silver and he’s also like—
Travis
lines: That’s a good look though, Griffin.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s a good look, but—

speaker: Travis
lines: Like, I know that you were trying to make him sound haggard, but like—

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, he’s— he’s on some Malfoy shit, for sure—

speaker: Travis
lines: —that young, silver fox…

speaker: Griffin
lines: —but he’s also severely injured.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh. That’s a good look, y’know?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He’s laying in Antonia’s lap and she’s trying to comfort him but she— she’s not looking at him, like she’s not looking down at him while she’s— she’s doing so, and you realize she’s wearing a bandage wrapped around her head that’s just covering her eyes. And Rowan is standing and facing the screen and he looks just withered up. He looks so worn down. You can see big patches missing from his big, red beard.

speaker: Travis
lines: [softly] No!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And you can’t hear anyone on the other side, but you can tell that Sterling is just like wailing, and this column of black smoke is just pouring out of him. And as Rowan recognizes you guys on the other side of the screen, you see him mouth the word, clear as day, “Why?”

speaker: Travis
lines: I point at Taako.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then the screen shuts off. And, how are y’all doing? I haven’t asked you that this arc, and I feel like that was a good thing to know in the last one. Just like, a quick ch— a quick emoji check-in with the boys.

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, I don’t physically feel great. I’ve had better days, physically. Um, emotionally, I’m about over it.

speaker: Travis
lines: [laughs] Yeah…

speaker: Justin
lines: From like an emotional perspective, I think I’m pretty well… done with these people, with these creatures.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, I would say Magnus is kinda in a— like, physical, taking a lot of like, physical damage, is like Magnus; you know, he’s a tank, that’s his MO. But like, he’s just being worn down psychologically by this shit.

speaker: Clint
lines: And Merle’s saying, “Ah, I’m okay. How are you?”

speaker: Travis
lines: You lost an eyeball!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, that’s fair.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, I know, but—

speaker: Justin
lines: Except for continuing to run into door frames, Merle’s doing great.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The two elf liches, um, they seem to like notice that you guys aren’t, like, having a great time, and Lydia says

speaker: Lydia
lines: You all seem pretty down in the dumps. How would you like a bonus round?

speaker: Taako
lines: I’m good actually.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Sounds— Yeah, uh, sure.

speaker: Merle
lines: I’d like that about as much as a poke in the eye.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Cam looks over at you, Taako, and he says

speaker: Cam
lines: The bonus round is how I ended getting trapped here in the first place. I wouldn’t recommend it.

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, like, no shit… head!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah, dog.

speaker: Taako
lines: No kidding! I’m— so it’s the first part of this g—

speaker: Magnus
lines: You’re not like, tellin’ us, “Oh, what? It might be bad?”

speaker: Taako
lines: So it’s the first part of this game to be unpleasant? Excellent.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Edward is kind of awkwardly, like, tapping his fingers together, he’s like—

speaker: Edward
lines: It’s kind of… not optional, though.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah, I also figured that! Okay!

speaker: Taako
lines: Obviously.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And another pitch-black door opens up behind them as they disappear, and it leads you into the next chamber, which I’m assuming you’re— you’re popping into, unless you wanna hang out and—

speaker: Travis
lines: Sure.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I mean you can— you can look around this room more if you— if you want. There’s— like I said, there’s just a bunch of these marionettes just now all inactive. Actually, they’re just sitting completely stationary in these risers facing the stage, just— just not moving. And they’re— they’re these intricately made with all these different points of articulation, these marionettes, but they have no face.

speaker: Travis
lines: I take one of their arms.

speaker: Merle
lines: Hey, Magnus… Yeah, I was gonna say, “Take an arm, baby!”

speaker: Magnus
lines: I need to rebuild my collection.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Sure, you, uh, you pop off one of their arms and now you have a wooden arm. Cool.

speaker: Travis
lines: And then I slap the laughing marionette with the arm and I say

speaker: Magnus
lines: Pull yourself together!

speaker: Griffin
lines: As you hit the laughing marionette, it stops— it finally stops moving.

speaker: Merle
lines: Let’s go, guys!

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah. We’re following.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. In the next chamber, you’re in another large circular room about the same dimensions as the one you just left, and in front of you are three large platforms, just not— not very high up, about a foot and a half off the ground. And each one has a huge multicolored neon sign hanging above it. And one says, “Escape Game,” one says, “Healing Game,” and one says, “Recovery Game.” And as you walk in you hear Lydia say

speaker: Lydia
lines: Oh! Wait a moment! One of you has already played the escape game!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And that pedestal dissolves into black smoke and wafts up into the ceiling. And so, you’re just left with two platforms that say “Healing Game” and “Recovering Game.” And you hear Edward say

speaker: Edward
lines: For the bonus round, you get to decide what game you want to play! Both are terrific little diversions, but this time you only get to pick one!

speaker: Clint
lines: So we have to assume that “Heal” means we get healed, and “Recover” means we get to take something back that we gave up, I would assume.

speaker: Justin
lines: Maybe our, but maybe just spell slots and stuff. Um, recover those, I don’t know.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Cam— Cam still looks like, like, kind of uncomfortable just being in this bonus room decision chamber.

speaker: Taako
lines: Cam, which one did you choose? What happened?

speaker: Cam
lines: I— I ended up— I ended up playing the Escape Game.

speaker: Taako
lines: Oh good!

speaker: Cam
lines: And I— well, I, I lost and that’s— that’s why I’m here, and a head.

speaker: Magnus
lines: How do you lose a bonus round? Wait, hold on, hold on! I’m— I’m no games master, but a bonus round should just be winning.

speaker: Cam
lines: Well, it was a bonus round for the person who won. It was kinda like the Decision Game. I came in here, I was hired to guide someone in here, and we were doing— well, we weren’t doing very well, we made it through a couple rounds, and then we played the Escape Game and they made us an offer where if one of us betrayed the other, we could escape, but we’d leave the other one to be stuck in Wonderland to suffer eternally.

speaker: And I told her it was a trap, I told her anybody who left this place alone wouldn’t survive 10 minutes in the Felicity Wilds but she took the offer and, well, here I am.
Magnus
lines: This— this person you were guiding. Older lady?

speaker: Cam
lines: Yeah, but I mean, she got older while we were here, yeah.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah, yeah, okay.

speaker: Taako
lines: Right. Right. Okay.

speaker: Cam
lines: Wait, do you know—

speaker: Magnus
lines: What?

speaker: Cam
lines: Do you know Lucretia?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Just a guess.

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, we do. We’re kinda working for her, basically.

speaker: Cam
lines: So she trapped you in here too?

speaker: Magnus
lines: She… sent us in to save you?

speaker: Cam
lines: Wait, she sent you in to save me?

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, we’re here to…

speaker: Cam
lines: She sent you in to save me?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Sure!

speaker: Taako
lines: Totally, man. Rescue mish.

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Taako
lines: Die-hard rescue mish. We’re here for you.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You see, like, a tear start to well up in his eyes.

speaker: Magnus
lines: You should probably stay hydrated because I don’t think you can drink water.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He’s kinda speechless. He says

speaker: Cam
lines: Maybe I was wrong about her. I don’t know that I can escape anymore. I’m pretty sure—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Well, no, they took the pedestal away.

speaker: Cam
lines: Well, no, it’s not just that. I mean, I’m just— I’m just a head. I’m pretty sure it’s this place that’s keeping me alive in the first place, but that means a lot. Thanks guys.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You just hear Edward just go, like,

speaker: Edward
lines: [clears throat]

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Merle
lines: Lemme be a coach for a second. Look, we’re not gonna escape, but I say we go for heal, right? The stuff we’ve given up, we gave up of our own free will—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Well, okay—

speaker: Merle
lines: Let’s get healed up! We’re not gonna get healed any other way!

speaker: Magnus
lines: But hold on, if I might counterpoint for a second. Cam makes it sound, and Cam, please correct me if I’m wrong, makes it sound like only one of us will get and the other will lose.

speaker: Edward
lines: Maybe!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You hear Edward say.

speaker: Magnus
lines: So it sounds like in the heal chamber, maybe like one of us gets healed but the other two lose hit points.

speaker: Taako
lines: That would be fine.

speaker: Clint
lines: Taako’s down to like a decimal point something.

speaker: Taako
lines: We could make that work.

speaker: Merle
lines: I say we do it anyway.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah, now that you mention it, I’m still doing pretty good, so like, sure, let’s do it. Heal.

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, let’s go to the healing room.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay! You all step up onto the “Healing” platform, and as you do, a ripple of light emits from the platform and everything else in the room disappears.

speaker: Justin
lines: As the light comes down, Taako is hit by the realization that there’s a possibility that this room could test the healing abilities of our party and he’s hit with a deep existential dread. Just like—

speaker: Justin
lines: — a mortal panic. He basically like, tries to get off the pedestal and just can’t in time.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um.

speaker: Clint
lines: Talking about me, aren’t you?

speaker: Travis
lines: I guess I should also ask, Ditto—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Do I see anything bef— let’s retcon a second, before we step on this platform, does the True Sight reveal anything?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Huh. I’ll tell you what, that’s a really good question. Yeah, your True Sight showed you when you walked into this chamber, Magnus, and it’s something the other boys didn’t see, is that like, for a split second, everything in this chamber was just black smoke, like the same black smoke that you’ve seen that pours out of you when you have a bad time.

speaker: It was just black smoke, and then it kind of like, firm— firms up. Almost like uh, you know how “pop-in” in video games works, where you’re too far away from a thing and then it just like “boop!” It was kinda like that. And you were the only one that kinda saw it. It was like the contents of this room, like, had to load in for a second.
Travis
lines: Gotcha.

speaker: Griffin
lines: How’s that? So this light ripples throughout the room, and all of a sudden the three of you are all standing in front of a little pedestal with two buttons on it, and the buttons are labeled with the other names of the people in your party. So, Taako, you’re standing in front of one that says “Magnus” and “Merle,” and so on. And you hear Lydia explain— oh, and there’s like— there’s like bright like neon trim lights running all around the room and the words “Healing Game” are floating in a big sign between all of your pedestals. And Lydia says

speaker: Lydia
lines: We know some of you are fear— faring a little bit worse than others, so we thought we’d give you the chance to balance out some of your current states of physical well-being. So, in the Healing Game, we’ll allow you to transfer some of your vitality over to a friend. But, in doing so, you will experience a bit of energy degradation during the transfer, so they’ll only receive half the vitality that you send in their direction.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So, in the Healing Game, you can give another person on your team some hit points at the cost of 2 to 1.

speaker: Travis
lines: And how many hit points does Cam have to give to Taako?

speaker: Griffin
lines: This is a great point. Okay, Cam also has a little pedestal, and it has all your guys’ names on it, and you all have a pedestal that has Cam’s name on it, and he’s like

speaker: Cam
lines: I’m gonna be honest, I’m just a head, so, uh, I don’t really have a lot to give or receive? So if— I’m probably gonna abstain from this challenge. I’m actually good to go; I’m full of hit points, there’s just like, four of them.

speaker: Clint
lines: [laughs] Alright!

speaker: Travis
lines: What are you down to, Taako?

speaker: Justin
lines: Fourteen.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, I’m at like, 75.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay, even though there’s some internet discrepancy, I maintain that I’m at 71, so I’m gonna give, do I hit the button of who I wanna give it to?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh-huh.

speaker: Clint
lines: Alright. I hit “Taako,” and I give 40.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That would kill you.

speaker: Clint
lines: No, no—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh you’re giving, so he’s getting 20.

speaker: Clint
lines: Right.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, okay. I thought you were saying you’re giving him 40 so you were subtracting 80. That would be a fun way for Merle to go, um, by— he’d just be pressing a button—

speaker: Travis
lines: [dramatically] The ultimate heal. He made the ultimate heal!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. “Now who can’t heal,” dead. Uh, all right, Taako, heal 20, and Merle, take 40 points of damage.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: That was bold and brassy.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Magnus? Do you do anything?

speaker: Travis
lines: Uh, Taako, what’s your max?

speaker: Griffin
lines: It recently went down.

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, yeah, uh, I am currently at 34. My max is 49. I don’t see—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Holy shit.

speaker: Justin
lines: What?

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s just real low.

speaker: Justin
lines: Is it? Is it, Griffin? Is it?

speaker: Justin
lines: Is it “real low”? Is it almost like some fucking liches of your imagination sucked my hit points away from me, a wizard? Is that what hap— is that what may account for the lowness?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, it’s real weird. It’s like really, it’s like, real low.

speaker: Justin
lines: It’s like so crazy low, huh? It’s just super wicked low, it’s all I can think about.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh-huh.

speaker: Travis
lines: I kinda feel like, so, I feel like I wanna do like that guy in The Office that when everyone like starts collecting for charity, you don’t really wanna give but you also don’t wanna be the only one who doesn’t. So I’ll give like 10 of my hit points to give Taako 5. That’s also like 10 percent of Taako’s health, though. So.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [laughs] Alright. You just lightly tap the “Taako” button.

speaker: Travis
lines: I mean, I nee— Okay, like on a—

speaker: Taako
lines: Guys! I don’t know what just happened but I had a skinned knee and it healed over!

speaker: Travis
lines: But like, my job is to get hit!

speaker: Taako
lines: Not all the— not all the— not all the way!

speaker: Travis
lines: Taako’s job is to stand in the back!

speaker: Taako
lines: It’s still red. It’s not healed up completely, but like it’s definitely somewhat healed. A little bit.

speaker: Griffin
lines: There’s still like a little raspberry there.

speaker: Taako
lines: Thank you for whoever was so kind to donate that.

speaker: Travis
lines: You know, it averages out that like we gave you 12 and a half points each.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, as—

speaker: Clint
lines: Nah, nah! No, it doesn’t really! As someone who has taken a lot of shit over being a bad healer, I don’t think it averages out at all.

speaker: Travis
lines: I just healed and I’m the tank, so who’s the best healer, really? Y’know, you’re supposed to heal.

speaker: Clint
lines: How much did you heal? You did a knee.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, I’m gonna say that—

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah! A very important knee!

speaker: Griffin
lines: While all of this is taking place, just a little bit of that smoke is coming out of you guys as you have this argument.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, alright, yeah. Alright.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, yeah, that’s fine.

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s fair.

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s fair.

speaker: Taako
lines: Thank you to everyone who gave an average of 12 and a half hit points, I really appreciate it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And uh—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Hey, least we could do, buddy.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And, uh, Taak— Magnus, you actually see that Red Robe, who has sorta been shadowing you from behind, he floats into the middle of the three of you and he sucks up a lil bit of that black smoke. [lip smacking] Tasty, tasty.

speaker: Travis
lines: [laughs] What a dirty bird.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And yeah, joking aside, like, Taako, you looked fucking pretty bad still from that washing machine that fell on you, but you’re— you’re actually looking a lot better, like your wounds really have closed up a bit. Merle, on the other hand, you actually have started to look a little bit bad now. And Magnus, you also have a skinned knee. And you feel it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And can I say something? It stings. Doesn’t feel good.

speaker: Clint
lines: He should have— shouldn’t he have two skinned knees?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, that’s a great point. [laughing] You have two skinned knees because of the 2 to 1.

speaker: Travis
lines: Well, wouldn’t it just be that one of the skinnings is twice as big?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Nope. You got two skinned knees. It’s a— It’s a really good look. And with that, the lights in this room kinda shut off and another door opens up in the back of the room, another pitch-black door.

speaker: Taako
lines: Let’s do it.

speaker: Travis
lines: Am— Am I— Griffin, am I safe to assume that I’m seeing a lot of like “And the black smoke starts to fade in this room and form a new room” kinda thing?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, actually, you see the inverse as you leave this room, you see it like start to unload a little bit and then as you— as soon as you walk into the next room you see it sorta fade in, just like a second too late. And it is another room with— I mean, it’s not another room, it’s the same room with that big ol’ Wheel of Sacrifice in the middle of it. The Wheel— I wanted to call it the Wheel of Misfortune but I think that was an old Animaniacs goof.

speaker: Travis
lines: No, that was Wheel of Morality.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Wheel of Morality! Damn it, you’re right. But yeah! The three of you, with Cam, walk into the Wheel room and you see the same big stone door on the far side with four dots over it that are sort of a dim red and it’s the same old wheel and you hear Edward say

speaker: Edward
lines: [rushed] It’s the Wheel of Sacrifice! You guys know the score. Just really spin it around, fill up the dots.

speaker: Clint
lines: [laughs] It’s like one of those disclaimers on the auto ads.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And you hear Lydia say

speaker: Lydia
lines: Edward, can you— take this seriously, please? This round, as you might expect, the sacrifices will be a little bit more intense than they have been, but I know that the thr— well, the four of you, have it in you!

speaker: Clint
lines: I did— I didn’t expect it to get worse!

speaker: Justin
lines: Ugh! I kinda did.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah…

speaker: Clint
lines: [in a “Droopy” voice] Glass half empty, oh my.

speaker: Griffin
lines: A little bit of smoke— a li’l— a little bit of smoke came out of Taako with that.

speaker: Justin
lines: All right. All right. Fine.

speaker: Clint
lines: You gotta stop going Eeyore on us, man.

speaker: Justin
lines: I know. Uh, so who’s gonna go first?

speaker: Travis
lines: I’ll do it!

speaker: Clint
lines: Are we doing it four times again?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yep!

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Clint
lines: [barely audible] Shit—

speaker: Travis
lines: Magnus spins! [brief pause] Swords.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Awesome. Excellent. Excellent. Yes. Phenomenal. Uh, Magnus, you hear Edward say

speaker: Edward
lines: Mm, perfect. Magnus, if you choose to accept this sacrifice, you will lose a fight.

speaker: Edward
lines: Literally, you will lose a fight, you will have a fight taken from you.

speaker: Merle
lines: Hm.

speaker: Edward
lines: What do you say?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Huh. Well, y’know, this is one of those circumstances, I’m gonna say, this one’s not gonna be up to me. Taako, Merle, Cam, um, this sounds like it’s more you guys having to fight a fight without me,

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, no. I’m so— I’m sorry.

speaker: Clint
lines: I think he’s talking about a past fight that you’ve fought.

speaker: Edward
lines: No, no, no, you misunderstand. You won’t have to leave your friends in the lurch and have them fight the fight themselves. The fight itself will be lost. It will be just gone, it will never exist. You will have the glory of an important battle just stripped away, as that battle simply won’t exist.

speaker: Magnus
lines: And remind me what happens if I say no?

speaker: Edward
lines: [weird, deep voice] Penalty. [normal voice] Sorry, I had a mouthful of coffee.

speaker: Clint
lines: [laughs] Lich coffee!

speaker: Magnus
lines: ’Cuz you sounded, you sounded very Eastwood there for a second.

speaker: Edward
lines: Yes.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Y’know what? Bite my butt, I’m taking the penalty.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Wow, okay. As you say that, you hear Lydia say

speaker: Lydia
lines: Wow, I’m, um, I have to admit, I’m pretty disappointed, I had a pretty good one— uh, lined up for you there.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah, that’s what I figured. You seemed very excited about it, and so, y’know, I just wanted to have a moment where I felt in control for a second.

speaker: Lydia
lines: Okay, well, you’re in control!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And you see a fifth dot appear over the door in front of you.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Well, dump.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Li’l bit— li’l bit of smoke comes out.

speaker: Taako
lines: That’s a real f— aw. Hey, y’know— not so bad?

speaker: Merle
lines: Hell, it’s good!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Actually, y’know, now that I think about it—

speaker: Taako
lines: But— But— But I will— I will say this you love fighting, huh? You just love it.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I do love fighting. Well, here, okay, listen though. What if that was a fight, like that was a boss battle to like save someone’s life that they took away from us, y’know what I mean?

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Say it was a similar fight to us fighting the Raven, like you know what I mean, like, that could’ve destroyed a whole town, could’ve ended the world.

speaker: Merle
lines: And you wouldn’t have gotten credit for it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You hear Edward say

speaker: Edward
lines: Uh, lucky you! You get to particip— you get to be in Wonderland even longer! You get to play the Wheel Game even more! This is a—

speaker: Merle
lines: I—

speaker: Edward
lines: I said penalty. I should’ve said Super Prize!

speaker: Merle
lines: That is great. Yahoo! Here we go! I’m spinning the wheel! And it’s stopping on… Mind.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh man.

speaker: Edward
lines: Merle, mind is a tough one. You’ve already lost some important memories to the wheel in this game, and for this third round of the Wheel Game, we’re gonna take some doozies from you if you accept it. So [blows air out shakily] if you accept this sacrifice Merle, you will lose the memories of the birth of your children!

speaker: Merle
lines: Take the penalty.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Merle’s gots kids?

speaker: Taako
lines: Imagine my shock Merle’s a dead-beat dad!

speaker: Taako
lines: Agag! Agog! I’m aghast!

speaker: Merle
lines: I’ll take the penalty!

speaker: Taako
lines: As nurturing as he is, y’know, as unw— Oh I guess I can’t talk yay about him anymore; he gave me a bunch of hit points. Yeah, it’s real bad. Can’t believe it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And with that, a sixth dot appears above the door, and you hear Lydia say

speaker: Lydia
lines: Oh, this is, you boys may wanna get comfortable in there because it seems like you might be in it for a while.

speaker: Taako
lines: I’m spinning the wheel. Hand.

speaker: Lydia
lines: Hand. Uh, let’s see. With hand, we will take away some of your… capabilities. Taako, you are an accomplished wizard, but you also have a certain other special knack that few wizards can claim. You can do sick flips and sweet tricks, and I think we’re gonna take some of that away.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And if you accept this sacrifice, you’re gonna take a— take a hit to your dexterity modifier as you become less— skillful, less acrobatic of a wizard.

speaker: Justin
lines: [sarcastic] Damn, I mean, the hard one for me about this is I’ve made such good use of my acrobatics skill at this point.

speaker: Justin
lines: It practically defines the character.

speaker: Travis
lines: Mhm.

speaker: Justin
lines: [blowing out air]

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, fine.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright. You step forward to like touch the Wheel and as you do, you kind of trip a little bit as—

speaker: Clint
lines: [like a sad trombone] Wah wah waaah!

speaker: Griffin
lines: So what’s your dex modifier, Taako?

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, three.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ah, no.

speaker: Justin
lines: Well, it’s 16, then plus three.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Naw, it’s a plus one.

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, that’s gonna hit your— that’s gonna hit a lot of stuff, probably. AC, initiative.

speaker: Justin
lines: Are you changin— you’re not changing my modifier, you’re changing my—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, yeah, whatever the score bumps it down to a plus one. I think that’s a 12 maybe.

speaker: Justin
lines: I just made it 126. That’s not accurate.

speaker: Griffin
lines: 126 is not— That would be a crazy sacrifice to make.

speaker: Travis
lines: Alright. Magnus is gonna spin.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright.

speaker: Travis
lines: [singing] Doot doot doo… Body.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [chuckles] Oh man.

speaker: Edward
lines: Uh, body we’ve seen before in past rounds, although I’ll admit it’s gonna hit you, the party’s main defender, much much harder than it did your— your accomplice. By choosing body you will have a significant amount of your vitality drained from you, Magnus.

speaker: Magnus
lines: [immediately] I accept.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Uh, it’s gonna take 20 off your max HP. You’re good?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yep.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright.

speaker: Clint
lines: Wait wait wait wait wait! Off the max HP?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yep.

speaker: Travis
lines: I mean, listen, my max HP is 111. So that drops me down to 91. I’m still doin’ fine.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright, you walk up to the wheel and just how you saw it happen to Magnus earlier— er, it happened to Taako earlier. You just feel some of your vitality like drain from you, and you get kinda like a sour feeling in your stomach, and you feel like a really harsh, like, cold chill kinda go through you.

speaker: Travis
lines: I’ll do some crunches later and get it back. Um—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Now we have two lights up—

speaker: Travis
lines: I spin again.

speaker: Griffin
lines: —two lights up over the— oh okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Skull.

speaker: Edward
lines: With skull you’re gonna have a spot of bad luck in the future, um, if you accept skull.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Well, I’m having plenty of bad luck now. I accept. Spin again.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright, Magnus is just going beast mode, hold on.

speaker: Merle
lines: I’m next.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Mind. I spin Mind.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh man. Oh, Trav, I could hurt you so bad with Mind though, bud.

speaker: Travis
lines: I know.

speaker: Griffin
lines: How do I wanna getcha? I have two ways to fuck you right now, Trav, and I’m trying to decide which one’s the best one. One’s hard. One’s real bad. I’m not gonna do that one. I’ll do the next one.

speaker: Edward
lines: Magnus.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Uh-huh.

speaker: Edward
lines: You have someone that you… loved once, right? And they were taken from you by someone who you now… hate. I wonder which one would be worse to take from you the person that you loved or the person that you… hate. I think we’ll go with… the latter. If you accept this sacrifice, you’ll forget Governor Kalen. You’ll forget all about him. You won’t be able to track him down— you just won’t know anything about Governor Kalen. You’ll forget what— you’ll remember what he did to you but you will not remember who did it.

speaker: Justin
lines: I whisper in, uh, Magnus’s ear.

speaker: Taako
lines: I don’t know who that is but that sounds [sing-song] chill as he-ell!

speaker: Magnus
lines: I mean, right? Like…

speaker: Taako
lines: Just let go, let go, my man. Finally, you can get your mind— That’s what, uh, that’s what this pers— whoever the person is, that I’m sure that’s what they’d want, right?

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah! Get on with your life!

speaker: Taako
lines: Get on with your life! What a gift!

speaker: Magnus
lines: You know, here’s the thing—

speaker: Taako
lines: Wait a minute! So those are the terms?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yep!

speaker: Taako
lines: Uh, Magnus.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Uh-huh.

speaker: Taako
lines: Tell me what happened?

speaker: Edward
lines: I— I’m sorry, I see what you all are doing here, and we’ve been running Wonderland for long enough. He won’t be able to remember no matter what.

speaker: Merle
lines: [whispering] I hate these liches.

speaker: Edward
lines: You can tell him the story or whatever but uh it’s— that would be a shitty sacrifice, don’t you think?

speaker: Taako
lines: It’s alright, I saw Memento.

speaker: Magnus
lines: You know what? Here’s what I’m going to say. Merle, Taako—

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Don’t try to remind me of it. But if in your journeys, you ever meet a slimy asshole named Governor Kalen, kill him on sight. Don’t talk to him. Don’t let him talk to you. Kill him. And tell him it’s for Julia. That’s the one thing I want you to say to his face before you kill him. “This is for Julia,” then you end him then and there. Understood?

speaker: Taako
lines: And then loot— and then loot him for Julia!

speaker: Magnus
lines: You do whatever the fuck you want after that.

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah, well, listen. We kill most of the people we come in contact anyway.

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah yeah! Statistically speaking we were probably gonna kill him eventually. So—

speaker: Merle
lines: Deal made!

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, deal confirmed.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Accepted.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And just like that, like, Magnus’s quest for vengeance just… ends.

speaker: Clint
lines: And ours begin!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You’re at four out of six lights.

speaker: Merle
lines: I’m spinning. I’m spinning.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Go for it.

speaker: Merle
lines: Alright, let’s see.

speaker: Justin
lines: Oh, sorry. Lemme bring it up.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That was real cool, Magnus.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Hey, thanks. [pause] What was?

speaker: Clint
lines: Merle spins Swords.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Hmmm.

speaker: Clint
lines: C’mon. C’mon. Give it to me.

speaker: Edward
lines: The problem with swords for you, Merle, is you’re just not a very—

speaker: Merle
lines: [laughing] I haven’t won any fights!

speaker: Edward
lines: Yeah, you’re not a very combative person.

speaker: Merle
lines: One moment, please. Who killed the spider in our very first adventure? The big hairy spider.

speaker: Edward
lines: I… You know, I wasn’t there for that, so I’m not sure.

speaker: Merle
lines: Well… Yeah…

speaker: Edward
lines: Instea— I’ll change it because I don’t know that you have any big, glorious battles in the future—

speaker: Merle
lines: Oh, bite me!

speaker: Edward
lines: —that I can take away from you—

speaker: Griffin
lines: A little bit of smoke comes out of you when you say that.

speaker: Edward
lines: But, uh, how about this? In your next battle here in Wonderland, you’re gonna be a real dunce.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And if you accept this—

speaker: Travis
lines: No, but what’s his punishment?

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, no, but then what happens after, yeah?

speaker: Griffin
lines: If you accept this one, every— everything you do in the next battle here in Wonderland, you will have disadvantage.

speaker: Merle
lines: Accepted.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright! Five out of six.

speaker: Edward
lines: You b— You three are—

speaker: Merle
lines: Wait! Accepted, you pricks!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Li’l bit of that—

speaker: Justin
lines: Oh, that’s good. Make more black smoke.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Li’l bit of that smoke.

speaker: Justin
lines: [crosstalk] All right.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And again you see some of it get peeled off, and Magnus, you see, you see that Red Robe just eatin’ it all up.

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m gonna spin the, uh, the wheel now. Clock.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ooh. Taako. My sweet Taako.

speaker: Taako
lines: What’s up?

speaker: Griffin
lines: How do elven ages work?

speaker: Taako
lines: I thought you been running Wonderland for a long time. [laughs]

speaker: Merle
lines: And you’re elves!

speaker: Griffin
lines: This is, this is Griffin, this is Griffin asking.

speaker: Merle
lines: Or aren’t they?!

speaker: Griffin
lines: How ’bout this? [very quickly] How ’bout this? How ’bout this? How ’bout this? We’ll leave it abstract. [normal] I’ll take it from the— I’ll take it— I got another thing.

speaker: Edward
lines: Taako, you are, uh, you are of the elven people and— a good looking one, at that. And so taking time from you is a tricky prospect because elves can live a long, long time, and we don’t want to establish a discrepancy in the sacrifices that we demand from our participants, so instead of taking your age from you…

speaker: Taako
lines: Mm?

speaker: Edward
lines: What if we sort of… take away something that diminishes over time? Which is to say… some of your beauty, Taako!

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh ho ho ho ho! [laughs]

speaker: Edward
lines: I wonder if you would accept a sacrifice that deals a hit to your vanity like that. If you take this, Taako, you’ll just become… slightly less of— of just a beautiful, young elf man.

speaker: Merle
lines: Can he choose what part of him is not as attractive?

speaker: Taako
lines: Will it, will it ma— okay.

speaker: Taako
lines: So like, I’ll go from sort of uh… feminine ethereal beauty to more like a, sort of a craggy, Richard Burton kind of…

speaker: Taako
lines: … handsome kind of thing.

speaker: Edward
lines: More of a Richard Karn-esque beauty is what we’re talkin’ about.

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s way too beautiful, Griffin. Choose again.

speaker: Edward
lines: More of a Richard Linklater. No, he looks good, damn it.

speaker: Justin
lines: He looks good, he looks fucking good.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You— [laughs] I love that you were just like, “Oh, yeah! My fucking agility in battle? Fuck that, no way. But my beauty… Hmmmm.”

speaker: Justin
lines: Well, you have to understand that like, for Taako, it’s not just vanity— I mean it’s like, the way he sees himself is as a television personality that has been disgraced, but will eventually come ba— not like television, but you know what I mean— who will reclaim his rightful place…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Right.

speaker: Justin
lines: Um and that— uh— this is counter to that.

speaker: Merle
lines: Hey, I’ll take another spin.

speaker: Taako
lines: No!

speaker: Griffin
lines: If you do that, you’d have two spins ’cuz you would lose one.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s how the penalty works.

speaker: Taako
lines: Ho— like how bad?

speaker: Clint
lines: [laughs] How ugly?

speaker: Lydia
lines: I’ll put it this way, Taako— for the first time in your life, you will simply look…normal. [Someone whistles] You will be… plain.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And you hear Edward say

speaker: Edward
lines: Well, that’s a fate worse than death if you ask me, but Taako, it’s your sacrifice to make, bud.

speaker: Taako
lines: I just don’t— I know I need to make a decision, here. It’s just— you know. It’s a tough one, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: [laughs] You say, to one-eyed Merle, and Magnus who just forgot the killer of his—

speaker: Travis
lines: No, listen, listen, listen. Everybody’s battles are their own and—

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, but like—

speaker: Travis
lines: — I’m not gonna sit there and tell Taako that his struggle is worse or less than mine. I realize how hard it—

speaker: Justin
lines: Taako is also not a good person! Like, Taako’s not a good person. [crosstalk] Like, this would be very hard.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, I know Taako well enough at this point to understand how hard this must be for him.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I understand if this is too much, and I’ll take two spins if you need to say no.

speaker: Taako
lines: Listen. I’ve thought about it a lot and uh, as near as I can figure, normal Taako is still head and shoulders above 90 percent of the population on this stupid planet.

speaker: Taako
lines: So let’s go ahead and go normal!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You instantly are changed, and you don’t feel it. And Merle and Magnus, like—

speaker: Merle
lines: Urgh!

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, he’s still look— he’s not unrecognizable, right, he still looks like Taako, but like, there’s, there are— there are differences that you— just because you’ve traveled with him for so long you can kind of pick out, just like, y’know his lips aren’t as full, and his eyes aren’t as soft.

speaker: Travis
lines: What’s the opposite of je-ne-sais-quoi?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He’s got the je-ne-sais-[flat noise].

speaker: Justin
lines: I cast Disguise Self on Taako.

speaker: Justin
lines: To make myself look like old Taako.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And instantly—

speaker: Travis
lines: Except I still see normal Taako.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Except he still sees normal Taako with his True Sight.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh dear god, this is getting confusing.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, it sure is! Uh, okay, Taako, you’re beautiful again, but you’re gonna have to keep burning that spell in order to keep yourself— That’s great, you have fucking arcane cosmetics now! This is the best game ever made!

speaker: Griffin
lines: With that, the sixth dot opens up, the sixth dot turns green and the big stone door opens up, uh, into the next chamber.

speaker: Clint
lines: [elongated] Shi-i-it.

speaker: Travis
lines: Griffin, where’s the, where’s the Red Robe right now?

speaker: Griffin
lines: The Red Robe is floating towards the door and motioning you towards it.

speaker: Magnus
lines: All right. Let’s go, boys!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And they step through the doors, and as they do, the Red Robe leans down, and you can like, see the Red Robe doing this now, and it extends a skeletal finger and prods it into your palm and makes a mark in it of Thieves Cant, and it’s a symbol that thieves use to let others know that it’s gonna pop off soon.

speaker: Travis
lines: Cool.

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s fun.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You move into the next room, and it’s another big circular chamber, and it’s the Trust or Forsake Room.  And you step in, and you don’t even get a rules explanation this time — I think that Edward and Lydia just assume that you know what the deal is, but these rings of light are emanating from the platform in the middle of the room, and the screen on it spins, and the face that pops up on it— I’m just gonna say it, because I rolled for the other two but I just want everybody to get a turn on it— Magnus! Your face, your pixelated character of your face appears on the pedestal and you hear Edward say

speaker: Edward
lines: Uh, you know what’s up, right? If things work in your favor you can breeze right through the next challenge, or you could face your doom; it’s up to you, Magnus. Have at it.

speaker: Travis
lines: And as I stare at the buttons, the sad face of Rowan appears before me, saying the word “Why?”

speaker: Travis
lines: And I look at Taako— And what is Taako doing, Justin?

speaker: Justin
lines: Taako, you see before her, the sad face of Taako — stop it! [Clint stops humming] — and Taako mouths,

speaker: Taako
lines: Because I would’ve died.

speaker: Travis
lines: And I look over at Merle. What’s Merle doing?

speaker: Clint
lines: Picking his nose.

speaker: Justin
lines: With his tree arm.

speaker: Travis
lines: And I look back at the button… and I see the face of Julia-! No, I hit “Trust.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Taako
lines: Son of a bitch.

speaker: Merle
lines: Stupid.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You hit “Trust” and the same sort of display appears in front of you again, and it says you chose “Trust,” and then it says they chose…

speaker: Clint
lines: Do you have a two-sided die?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, no.

speaker: Travis
lines: It’s called a quarter.

speaker: Griffin
lines: They also chose “Trust!”

speaker: Justin
lines: Hey!

speaker: Clint
lines: Yay!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Both parties chose “Trust” and you hear Edward say

speaker: Edward
lines: Aw… Okay. Sorry, this just like, never happens.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And the door on the other side of the room slides open.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Let’s go!

speaker: Justin
lines: Well, uh, let’s go!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Yeah, because you both chose “Trust,” you play the easiest version of the challenge ahead of you. I mean, it’s still gonna be tough, but, y’know.

speaker: Clint
lines: Can we win something this arc?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Boy, let’s see! You move into the next chamber and it’s another huge circular room, and you realize as you walk in that the walls and floors and ceiling of this room are all made out of this really detailed screen, almost like an LED screen and it’s showing, like, these scenic vistas, almost like its screensaver mode.

speaker: So, as you walk in this screen makes it look like you’re standing in a big tropical beach, and then it looks like you’re standing in this smoky forested mountain, and then it looks like you’re standing next to a babbling brook. And at the far end of this room is a pile of bodies, but as you approach them you realize that they’re not dead folks, they are more of those wooden marionettes. And it’s— they’re the same types, they’re intricately carved with all the different points of articulation and no faces. And as you enter the room, the screen around you goes dark, and you hear Lydia say
Lydia
lines: This challenge is gonna be fun to watch. Say, are any of you feeling particularly nostalgic?

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah, I long for the time when we weren’t in this place.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Merle as you say that a bit of black smog comes out of you—

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, yeah, yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And it joins a big cloud of black smog that lowers down from the ceiling, and this cloud, like, sucks up some of the mannequins from the pile and then all of a sudden this cloud takes the form of a massive red dragon. And the screens around you are displaying what looks like a dragon’s hoard, like a dragon’s cave. And you can see some of the mannequin shapes, like, floating in its semi-translucent skin but it looks and sounds so real, but then it changes shape and some of the mannequins fall out of the cloud, and it transforms into a hill giant, holding a massive club, and all of a sudden you’re standing in the ruins of a castle on a hill, that the— that the screen is showing you, and then the shape dissipates, and then it reforms, sucking up more of those mannequins from the back of the room.

speaker: And all of a sudden, it’s a floating beholder, with all of its different eyestalks glowing with different colours. And two mannequins raise up from the floor and all of a sudden, they’re surrounded by black smoke and they transform into mind flayers, and all the while, while you’re seeing these different scenes and this shape is transforming into different monsters, a word is circling the room on that screen that says “Calibrating.” And after a few more of these transformations all the mannequins fall to the floor, and the screen surrounding you lights up, and it makes it look like you’re standing in some sort of cavern.
[Wonderland
lines: Round Two fades in]

lines: Only, the walls of the cavern are giving off a faint glow, and then a bunch of mannequins are picked up off the ground, and absorbed by the smog and it starts to take shape, and you see eight long black legs with a thick body, and two sharp pincers, and a long stinger appear out of that smog. And one of the mannequins just stands up from the pile and is encircled with smog and suddenly that one is holding a smooth staff, and it’s wearing a fantastic robe, emblazoned with a spider.
